element.name: Median
element.short: calculates the median of a given dynamic array of Extended floating-point numbers

dl.dd: A dynamic array of Extended type numbers.

descr.p: Returns the median value of the array. If the array has an even number of elements, it returns the average of the two middle values.

element.name: MedianQuartiles
element.short: calculates the median and the first and third quartiles of a sorted dynamic array of Double values

dl.dd: A dynamic array of Double values. The array should be sorted for correct results.
An out parameter that will hold the calculated first quartile (Q1).
An out parameter that will hold the calculated third quartile (Q3).

descr.p: Returns the median of the dataset.

element.name: Zscore
element.short: Calculate the standard Z-Score for measurements of a taxon

descr.p: The Z-Score measures how many standard deviations an element is from the mean.

dl.dd: An Integer representing the taxon_id for filtering the data.
A String representing the database field (measurement) to analyze.
An Extended value to be tested.

element.name: ModifiedZScore
element.short: Calculate the Modified Z-Score for measurements of a taxon

descr.p: It is a robust alternative to the standard Z-Score that uses the median and Median Absolute Deviation (MAD) to detect outliers, making it less sensitive to extreme values.

dl.dd: An Integer representing the taxon_id for filtering the data.
A String representing the database field (measurement) to analyze.
An Extended value to be tested.

element.name: IsOutlier
element.short: Determines if a value is an outlier based on the Interquartile Range (IQR) method.

descr.p: An outlier is a value that falls below the first quartile (Q1) minus a factor times the IQR, or above the third quartile (Q3) plus a factor times the IQR.

dl.dd: An Integer representing the taxon_id for filtering the data.
A String representing the database field (measurement) to analyze.
An Extended value to be tested.
A Double value (default is 1.5) to multiply the IQR.

descr.p: Returns True if the value is an outlier, otherwise False.

element.name: IsOutlierZscore
element.short: Determines if a value is an outlier based on its Modified Z-Score.

descr.p: A value is considered an outlier if its absolute Modified Z-Score is greater than a predefined threshold.

dl.dd: An Integer representing the taxon_id for filtering the data.
A String representing the database field (measurement) to analyze.
An Extended value to be tested.

descr.p: Returns True if the absolute Modified Z-Score is greater than 3.5 (the common threshold), otherwise False.
